page.title: 08YE OLDE INNE,WESTERLEIGH.
page.content: { Ye Olde Inne (15th century)}was the original house for workers who built the nearby church.Two{passages,}now blocked off, lead from the cellar to the church and old friary.Several hundred people use the pub at weekends, but fewer on other days.{Regular visitors}mostly live locally but others come from Yate,Chipping Sodbury and Bristol. The present{landlord}has lived there for ten years.He enjoys it because it is more a{way of family life}than just a job .He starts work each day at 7.30a.m. by doing the accounts. Then he cleans the bars and cellar making sure that all the barrels are correct for when customers arrive. During the afternoon he potters outside, keeping the gardens tidy.Children can play outside or stay in the{family room.
